content.body: Is `{ subtree: false, customElements: true }` a valid input or is `customElements` relying on `subtree` being true?
content.formatted_body: Is { subtree: false, customElements: true } a valid input or is customElements relying on subtree being true?

content.body: I’m looking at https://github.com/mdn/content/pull/38254/files and wondering why MDN might have ever had `NodeFilter.SHOW_ATTRIBUTE` and `NodeFilter.SHOW_CDATA_SECTION` flagged as deprecated to begin with
content.formatted_body: I’m looking at https://github.com/mdn/content/pull/38254/files and wondering why MDN might have ever had NodeFilter.SHOW_ATTRIBUTE and NodeFilter.SHOW_CDATA_SECTION flagged as deprecated to begin with

content.body: Maybe just somebody was confused, or maybe just a plain mistake, I dunno

I’m going ahead and merging that patch, but… just curious about the history. git blame seems to shows it’s been that way since the old wiki days — before the sources were moved into a git repo (~5 years ago)
Kaiido: good question, that would be a valid input.
content.formatted_body: Kaiido: good question, that would be a valid input.

are made would have saved me a bit of time.

content.body: sideshowbarker: we tried to remove Attr and CDATASection nodes from the DOM and failed.
content.formatted_body: sideshowbarker: we tried to remove Attr and CDATASection nodes from the DOM and failed.

content.body: keithamus: https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/10869 and https://github.com/whatwg/dom/pull/1341 should be good now. I will update the PR template a bit. And I'll align WebKit and tests with the selfOnly member. I think that's the only thing we don't do yet.
content.formatted_body: keithamus: https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/10869 and https://github.com/whatwg/dom/pull/1341 should be good now. I will update the PR template a bit. And I'll align WebKit and tests with the selfOnly member. I think that's the only thing we don't do yet.

content.body: I also updated the HTML issue's OP so it has the latest IDL sketch. But I recommend working from the actual PRs.
